org.richfaces.fragment.tooltip

Interface Tooltip<CONTENT>

  • Type Parameters:
    CONTENT -
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RichFacesTooltip, TextualRichFacesTooltip

    public interface Tooltip<CONTENT>
    Author:
    Jiri Stefek

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CONTENT getContent()
      Gets the object representing the content of the tooltip.
      Tooltip<CONTENT> hide()
      Dismiss the tooltip, which is found by injected root element to his component.
      Tooltip<CONTENT> hide(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement target)
      Dismiss the tooltip over the given target.
      Tooltip<CONTENT> show()
      Invokes the tooltip over an element, which is found by injected root element to his component.
      Tooltip<CONTENT> show(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement target)
      Invokes the tooltip over the given target.

    • Method Detail

      • show

        Tooltip<CONTENT> show()
        Invokes the tooltip over an element, which is found by injected root element to his component. Note that, invoking of the tooltip should be rather by implicit action (for example hover of the mouse over some element), than this explicit call.
        Returns:
        tooltip itself

      • show

        Tooltip<CONTENT> show(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement target)
        Invokes the tooltip over the given target. Note that, invoking of the tooltip should be rather by implicit action (for example hover of the mouse over some element), than this explicit call.
        Parameters:
        target - the element on which the tooltip will be invoked
        Returns:
        tooltip itself

      • hide

        Tooltip<CONTENT> hide()
        Dismiss the tooltip, which is found by injected root element to his component. Note that, hiding of the tooltip should be rather by implicit action (for example hover of the mouse out from some element), than this explicit call.
        Returns:
        tooltip itself

      • hide

        Tooltip<CONTENT> hide(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement target)
        Dismiss the tooltip over the given target. Note that, hiding of the tooltip should be rather by implicit action (for example hover of the mouse out from some element), than this explicit call.
        Returns:
        tooltip itself

      • getContent

        CONTENT getContent()
        Gets the object representing the content of the tooltip.
        Returns:
        initialized page object with the content of this tooltip
        See Also:
        TextualRichFacesTooltip
